response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "Beginning 1/1/2026, this bill requires pharmacy technicians to be registered. [CHUNK_54] It imposes a duty on pharmacists-in-charge to report violations conducted by registered pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_54] The measure specifies that supervising registered pharmacists are responsible for the actions of registered pharmacy technicians and pharmacy interns. [CHUNK_54]",
  "appropriations": "This bill does not contain a legislative appropriation. [CHUNK_0] It establishes a registration fee for a pharmacy technician of $20.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_3] The measure also specifies that any person who violates the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not less than $100.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt) nor more than $1,000.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt) for each violation. [CHUNK_51]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided legislative documents do not contain any assumptions, cost estimation methods, or data sources used to calculate financial projections for this measure. [CHUNK_0] No comparable programs or historical budgets are referenced for the calculation of financial impact. [CHUNK_0] The fiscal impact is based solely on the fee and fine amounts stated in the bill. [CHUNK_3]",
  "agency_impact": "The board of pharmacy is granted the authority to issue certificates of registration for registered pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_13] The board may also fine, suspend, or revoke any registration for any cause prescribed by this chapter. [CHUNK_15] Additionally, the board shall adopt rules to define the qualifications and functions of the registered pharmacy technician. [CHUNK_30]",
  "economic_impact": "The primary economic effect is a registration fee for a pharmacy technician which shall be $20.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_3] Additionally, any person who violates the provisions of the chapter shall be fined not less than $100.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt) nor more than $1,000.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt) for each violation. [CHUNK_51] The documents do not detail any expected cost savings or other benefits to the community. [CHUNK_0]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure amends Chapter 461, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by requiring that no person shall act as a pharmacy technician without first obtaining a valid registration issued by the board beginning January 1, 2026. [CHUNK_1] It modifies existing law by specifying that the supervising registered pharmacist shall be responsible for the actions of the registered pharmacy technician. [CHUNK_4] The bill also adds a new definition for \"Registered pharmacy technician\" to the statutes. [CHUNK_9]",
  "revenue_sources": "Revenue to support this measure will be generated from a registration fee for pharmacy technicians. [CHUNK_3] The registration fee for a pharmacy technician shall be $20.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_3] Additional revenue may be generated from fines, as any person who violates the provisions of this chapter shall be fined not less than $100.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt) nor more than $1,000.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt) for each violation. [CHUNK_51]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "Beginning January 1, 2026, this measure will generate revenue for the state. [CHUNK_1] A registration fee of $20.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt) is established for each pharmacy technician. [CHUNK_3] Each registration shall be valid through December 31 of each odd-numbered year, establishing a recurring biennial revenue stream. [CHUNK_2] Potential revenue may also be generated from fines for violations, which range from $100.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt) to $1,000.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_51] The provided documents do not include projections on the number of pharmacy technicians who will register. [CHUNK_0] There is no information regarding necessary staffing changes or other recurring expenses related to the administration of this registration program. [CHUNK_0] Therefore, a detailed six-year fiscal projection cannot be accurately calculated based on the available information. [CHUNK_0] The initial revenues from registration would be collected for the biennium ending December 31, 2027. [CHUNK_2] The bill does not outline any plans for program expansion. [CHUNK_0] All proceedings for denial, suspension, fine, or revocation of a registration shall be conducted pursuant to chapter 91, which may have associated administrative costs. [CHUNK_52]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "This measure will have a positive impact on operating revenues. [CHUNK_3] The State will collect a registration fee for a pharmacy technician of $20.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_3] Additional, non-recurring revenue may be collected from fines of not less than $100.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt) nor more than $1,000.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt) for each violation. [CHUNK_51]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided legislative documents do not indicate any capital expenditures related to this measure. [CHUNK_0] No investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure are mentioned. [CHUNK_0] The measure focuses on registration and regulation, not capital improvements. [CHUNK_1]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The fiscal implications after six years will consist of ongoing biennial revenue from the collection of the pharmacy technician registration fee of $20.00 (HB72_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_3] Since each registration shall be valid through December 31 of each odd-numbered year, the fee collection is a recurring event. [CHUNK_2] The provided documents do not contain information regarding the long-term sustainability of this funding or the projected number of registered technicians. [CHUNK_0]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "No previous fiscal note was provided for comparison. [CHUNK_0]",
  "fte_positions": "The provided legislative documents do not specify the addition or modification of any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions. [CHUNK_0] There is no mention of new roles required to administer the registration program. [CHUNK_0] The bill does not address staffing changes. [CHUNK_0]",
  "appropriations_changes": "No appropriations are specified in this bill. [CHUNK_0] Therefore, there are no appropriations to modify or change from any previous versions. [CHUNK_0] The bill focuses on establishing fees and fines rather than allocating funds. [CHUNK_3]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "The bill establishes new revenue sources through registration fees and fines. [CHUNK_3] No previous funding sources were identified, so there are no changes in the method of funding to report. [CHUNK_0] The bill does not shift funding between general and special funds. [CHUNK_0]",
  "department_impact": "The bill assigns new regulatory responsibilities to the board of pharmacy. [CHUNK_13] There is no mention of a change in which department is responsible for expending appropriations. [CHUNK_0] The bill does not shift responsibilities from one department to another. [CHUNK_0]",
  "reports_required": "The bill requires a pharmacist-in-charge to notify the board, in writing, within ten days if a registered pharmacy technician is suspected to have violated any law or regulation. [CHUNK_6] If any danger to the public health or safety exists, the notification must be made immediately. [CHUNK_7] Any other registered pharmacist with such knowledge or suspicion must also notify the board. [CHUNK_7]",
  "pilot_program": "This bill does not create a pilot program for pharmacy technician registration; it establishes a permanent requirement. [CHUNK_1] The bill does state that the board may approve pilot and demonstration research projects for innovative applications in the practice of pharmacy. [CHUNK_18] However, the core of this legislation is the creation of a mandatory registration system. [CHUNK_1]",
  "sunset_date": "The provided legislative documents do not contain a sunset date for the program or the bill. [CHUNK_0] The registration requirement for pharmacy technicians appears to be permanent. [CHUNK_1]",
  "effective_date": "This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [CHUNK_53] There is no mention of a defective effective date in any previous version. [CHUNK_0]"
}

overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fisacl not. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fisacl note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.

Registered Pharmacy Technicians; Registration Description: Beginning 1/1/2026, requires physician technicians to be registered. Imposes a duty on pharmacists-in-charge to report violations conducted by registered pharmacy technicians.
